channel.title: Problem adding Dicing
channel.description:
In my player.java I have: [code] public int succeslvl; public int xamount; public int monkeyk0ed; public int diceDelay; [/code]
Compilier errors: [code] src\server\model\players\packets\ClickItem.java:57: error: possible loss of prec ision c.diceDelay = System.currentTimeMillis(); ^ required: int found: long src\server\model\players\packets\ClickItem.java:63: error: possible loss of prec ision c.diceDelay = System.currentTimeMillis(); ^ required: int found: long src\server\model\players\packets\ClickItem.java:69: error: possible loss of prec ision c.diceDelay = System.currentTimeMillis(); ^ required: int found: long src\server\model\players\packets\ClickItem.java:75: error: possible loss of prec ision c.diceDelay = System.currentTimeMillis(); ^ required: int found: long src\server\model\players\packets\ItemClick2.java:44: error: possible loss of pre cision c.diceDelay = System.currentTimeMillis(); ^ required: int found: long src\server\model\players\packets\ItemClick2.java:58: error: possible loss of pre cision c.diceDelay = System.currentTimeMillis(); ^ required: int found: long src\server\model\players\packets\ItemClick2.java:72: error: possible loss of pre cision c.diceDelay = System.currentTimeMillis(); ^ required: int found: long src\server\model\players\packets\ItemClick2.java:86: error: possible loss of pre cision c.diceDelay = System.currentTimeMillis(); ^ required: int found: long Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details. 8 errors Press any key to continue . . . [/code]
How could I fix this?

item.title: Problem adding Dicing
item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

[quote=“Trade Me, post:5, topic:454395”]Quite Frankly, I do not know what a data type is…
I’m still learning… Asking question’s… Reading books… And taking tutorials online…

I had followed this tutorial:
www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,508501.0.html

And it had told me to do the following:

[quote]
Now go to Player.java and add this next to the other delays:

diceDelay

[/quote][/quote]

He never told you that you had to declare it as an integer. Add this in client.java

Read full topic

item.title: Problem adding Dicing
item.dc:creator: @Trade_Me Trade Me
item.description:
@Trade_Me wrote:

Quite Frankly, I do not know what a data type is…
I’m still learning… Asking question’s… Reading books… And taking tutorials online…

I had followed this tutorial:
www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,508501.0.html

And it had told me to do the following:

Now go to Player.java and add this next to the other delays: [code] diceDelay [/code]

EDIT:
AHA! I had clicked your link on data type’s and I had actually added my own lousy and useless data type that allows you to swim, Along with turning stopping walking and running in combatassistant.java

Read full topic

item.title: Problem adding Dicing
item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

Do you not know what a data type is? currentTimeMillis() is a long, and your needing to change diceDelay to a long.

Read full topic

item.title: Problem adding Dicing
item.dc:creator: @Trade_Me Trade Me
item.description:
@Trade_Me wrote:

What do I put? This…

        public int succeslvl;
        public int xamount;
        public int monkeyk0ed;
        public int diceDelay;

To this?

        public int succeslvl;
        public int xamount;
        public int monkeyk0ed;
        public int diceDelay = System.currentTimeMillis();

xD?

Read full topic

item.title: Problem adding Dicing
item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

currentTimeMillis() is a long, you’ll have to change the variable to a long or cast it to an int.

Why would you want the delay to be the current time?

if (System.currentTimeMillis() >= diceDelay) { roll(); //Whatever your rolling method is. }

Read full topic
